sentence.Network_en: China boasts the world's earliest observatory, built in Nanking in 1385 in the Ming Dynasty ( 1368 A . D . - 1644 A . D . ), three centuries ahead of the Greenwich Observatory built in Britain in 1670.
sentence.Network_cn: 中国建有世界上最早的气象台. 公元1385年,明朝在南京建立观象台, 比英国格林尼治观象台 ( 建于1670年 ) 早三个世纪.

sentence.Network_en: " What's so wonderful about occupying Nanking Road for a whole day, anyway?
sentence.Network_cn: “ 就是 整天占据了南京路, 也不算什么了不得呀!

sentence.Network_en: They picked up the daily broadcasts from Nanking, Shanghai, and Tokyo.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们每天收听南京 、 上海和东京的广播.
